makerbit.connectLcd:
Connects to the LCD at a given I2C address.
The addresses 39 (PCF8574) or 63 (PCF8574A) seem to be widely used.
makerbit.connectLcd|param|i2cAddress: I2C address of LCD in the range from 0 to 127, eg: 39
makerbit.isLcdConnected: Returns true if a LCD is connected. False otherwise.
makerbit.position1602: Turns a LCD position into a number.
makerbit.position2004: Turns a LCD position into a number.
makerbit.setLcdBacklight: Enables or disables the backlight of the LCD.
makerbit.setLcdBacklight|param|backlight: new state of backlight, eg: LcdBacklight.Off
makerbit.showStringOnLcd1602:
Displays a text on a LCD1602 in the given position range.
The text will be cropped if it is longer than the provided length.
If there is space left, it will be filled with pad characters.
makerbit.showStringOnLcd1602|param|lengt: the maximum space used on the LCD, eg: 16
makerbit.showStringOnLcd1602|param|optio: configures padding and alignment, eg: TextOption.Left
makerbit.showStringOnLcd1602|param|start: the start position on the LCD, [0 - 31]
makerbit.showStringOnLcd2004:
Displays a text on a LCD2004 in the given position range.
The text will be cropped if it is longer than the provided length.
If there is space left, it will be filled with pad characters.
makerbit.showStringOnLcd2004|param|lengt: the maximum space used on the LCD, eg: 20
makerbit.showStringOnLcd2004|param|optio: configures padding and alignment, eg: TextOption.Left
makerbit.showStringOnLcd2004|param|start: the start position on the LCD, [0 - 79]
